thinking.disposable_income: The South Acres / Crestmont Park neighborhood has a moderate to low disposable income, with many residents relying on affordable transportation options.
thinking.discretionary_consumption: Residents in this area have limited discretionary spending, prioritizing essential goods and services over luxury items.
thinking.accessibility: The neighborhood has moderate accessibility to resources and services, with a reliance on both public transit and personal vehicles for commuting and daily activities.
thinking.decision_rationale: Given the moderate to low disposable income, it is crucial to keep transportation costs affordable while improving transit efficiency. Lower fares and moderate driver fees are preferred to encourage transit use and reduce congestion. A balanced sales tax is necessary to support transit improvements without overly burdening residents' consumption. The selected policies aim to reduce travel time and costs for both transit users and drivers, enhancing overall accessibility and quality of life.
